02058     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
02059     void initialize();
02060     void cleanUp();
02061     void resetInProgress();
02062 
02063     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
02064     //  Private data members
02065     //
02066     //  fAttrList
02067     //      A temporary implementation of the basic SAX attribute list
02068     //      interface. We use this one over and over on each startElement
02069     //      event to allow SAX-like access to the element attributes.
02070     //
02071     //  fDocHandler
02072     //      The installed SAX doc handler, if any. Null if none.
02073     //
02074     //  fDTDHandler
02075     //      The installed SAX DTD handler, if any. Null if none.
02076     //
02077     //  fElemDepth
02078     //      This is used to track the element nesting depth, so that we can
02079     //      know when we are inside content. This is so we can ignore char
02080     //      data outside of content.
02081     //
02082     //  fEntityResolver
02083     //      The installed SAX entity handler, if any. Null if none.
02084     //
02085     //  fErrorHandler
02086     //      The installed SAX error handler, if any. Null if none.
02087     //
02088     //  fPSVIHandler
02089     //      The installed PSVI handler, if any. Null if none.
02090     //
02091     //  fAdvDHCount
02092     //  fAdvDHList
02093     //  fAdvDHListSize
02094     //      This is an array of pointers to XMLDocumentHandlers, which is
02095     //      how we see installed advanced document handlers. There will
02096     //      usually not be very many at all, so a simple array is used
02097     //      instead of a collection, for performance. It will grow if needed,
02098     //      but that is unlikely.
02099     //
02100     //      The count is how many handlers are currently installed. The size
02101     //      is how big the array itself is (for expansion purposes.) When
02102     //      count == size, is time to expand.
02103     //
02104     //  fParseInProgress
02105     //      This flag is set once a parse starts. It is used to prevent
02106     //      multiple entrance or reentrance of the parser.
02107     //
02108     //  fScanner
02109     //      The scanner being used by this parser. It is created internally
02110     //      during construction.
02111     //
02112     //   fGrammarPool
02113     //      The grammar pool passed from external application (through derivatives).
02114     //      which could be 0, not owned.
02115     //
02116     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
02117     bool                 fParseInProgress;
02118     XMLSize_t            fElemDepth;
02119     XMLSize_t            fAdvDHCount;
02120     XMLSize_t            fAdvDHListSize;
02121     VecAttrListImpl      fAttrList;
02122     DocumentHandler*     fDocHandler;
02123     DTDHandler*          fDTDHandler;
02124     EntityResolver*      fEntityResolver;
02125     XMLEntityResolver*   fXMLEntityResolver;
02126     ErrorHandler*        fErrorHandler;
02127     PSVIHandler*         fPSVIHandler;
02128     XMLDocumentHandler** fAdvDHList;
02129     XMLScanner*          fScanner;
02130     GrammarResolver*     fGrammarResolver;
02131     XMLStringPool*       fURIStringPool;
02132     XMLValidator*        fValidator;
02133     MemoryManager*       fMemoryManager;
02134     XMLGrammarPool*      fGrammarPool;
02135     XMLBuffer            fElemQNameBuf;
02136 };
02137
